desc.content: Each Event is a typical quiz event, consisting of prelims and finals, set by reputed QMs from across the country. Each Quiz Cup Event is a Group Event.

A Quiz that spans a vast spectrum of knowledge, encompassing anything and everything under the sun. With questions that traverse diverse topics, this quiz promises to challenge your wits and test both the depth and breadth of your understanding.
Spanning the entire sporting universe, from legendary athletes like Ashe to iconic events like the Ashes, this challenge covers all things sports-related.
From groundbreaking innovations and scientific breakthroughs to the latest trends in business and tech, this quiz challenges your knowledge across all aspects of the ever-evolving Sci-Biz-Tech world.

Delve deep into the realms of History, Etymology, Language, and Mythology. From tracing the origins of words to unearthing forgotten tales of the past, this quiz tests both depth and breadth of knowledge in the humanities.
From exploring global destinations to discovering unique lifestyles and rich cultural traditions, this quiz offers a comprehensive dive into Travelling, Living, and Culture.
The MELA Quiz encompasses Music, Entertainment, Literature, and Art — a broad quiz covering the creative and entertainment domains.
An immersive quiz on India's culture, art, history, sports, and beyond — exploring the richness of the nation.

General Rules:
- Number of teams per IIT: maximum 6 teams in prelims, out of which maximum 2 teams may qualify for the finals.
- Number of Participants in a team: maximum 3 (Group Event).
1. Each quiz consists of a written prelims round followed by finals for the 10 qualifying teams.
2. The quiz will start on the arrival of the quiz master. No request for delaying the quiz will be entertained.
3. In case of any discrepancy, the word of the quiz master shall be final and binding.
4. Use of unfair means will lead to immediate disqualification of the IIT from the Quiz Cup.
5. The Event Points would be given only to the top 8 finalist teams at the end of the Quiz. Prelims participation (at least one team in the prelims) would fetch 3 Event Points to IIT, irrespective of the number of teams.
6. A participant can only be a part of one team per quiz.
7. Tiebreakers and other rules will be announced by the quizmaster.
8. In case of multiple qualifications in the prelims, from the same IIT, only the best 2 teams from an IIT will proceed to the finals, and the points received by the highest placed team will be considered, and the rest positions obtained by the respective IITs will be blocked.
For queries regarding the Quiz Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.

Literary Arts Cup comprises multiple prose, poetry and word/speaking events: Hindi Story Writing, English Story Writing, Hindi Poetry Writing, English Poetry Writing, Cryptic Crossword and Scrabble. Events include both individual and group formats.

A prompt-based Individual Event where participants write a short story of 1000-2000 words in Hindi on the spot.

Teams per IIT: max 2
Duration: 4 hours
Specific Rules:
- Entries must have a title (Penalty: -5 pts).
- Word limit 2000 words. Penalties apply for exceeding.
- Written in Devanagari Script.

A prompt-based Individual Event where participants write a short story of 1000-2000 words in English on the spot.

Teams per IIT: max 2
Duration: 4 hours
Specific Rules:
- Entries must have a title (Penalty: -5 pts).
- Word limit 2000 words. Penalties apply for exceeding.
- Written in Roman/Latin Script.

A prompt-based Individual Event where participants write a poetry piece of 100-250 words in Hindi on the spot.

Teams per IIT: max 2
Duration: 2 hours
Specific Rules:
- Word limit 250 words. Penalties apply for exceeding.
- Written in Devanagari Script.

A prompt-based Individual Event where participants write a poetry piece of 100-250 words in English on the spot.

Teams per IIT: max 2
Duration: 2 hours
Specific Rules:
- Word limit 250 words. Penalties apply for exceeding.
- Written in Roman/Latin Script.

Decipher clues in a standard cryptic crossword grid. Top 8 teams proceed to finals (bounce/pounce + written).

Teams per IIT: max 4 (Group Event)
Duration: 1 hr prelims, 2 hrs finals
Specific Rules:
- More than two teams from the same IIT shall not advance to the finals.

A tournament on physical Scrabble Boards following WESPA 5.1 Rules.

Participants per IIT: 2 (Individual Event)
Duration: 44 minutes per game
Reference: Collins Dictionary (CSW24).

1. Plagiarism of any kind is not allowed. Stories can be inspired but must be declared. Plagiarism leads to disqualification.
2. Communication between teams during events is strictly prohibited and leads to disqualification.
3. The use of electronic gadgets (smartwatches, phones) is strictly prohibited.
4. Illustrations (graphs/sketches) are not allowed in writing events (Penalty: 5 pts).
5. Vulgarity/obscenity will be dealt with strictly and may lead to disqualification.
6. Entries must be written in the specified script (Devanagari for Hindi, Roman/Latin for English).
7. Late entry rules: No entry after 1 hour for Story Writing; 15 minutes for Poetry and Crossword.
For queries regarding Literary Arts Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
The Speaking Arts Cup consists of multiple individual and group speaking events including Hindi Slam Poetry, English Slam Poetry, Mushaira, Just-A-Minute, and Asian Parliamentary Debate.

Individual Event. Original poetry performance in Hindi.
Teams per IIT: 2
Duration: 5 mins
Rules: Devanagari script mandatory. Limited English/Urdu allowed.

Individual Event. Original poetry performance in English.
Teams per IIT: 2
Duration: 5 mins
Rules: Only English allowed.

Individual Event. Original Urdu poetry (Ghazal, Nazm, etc.) following metrical composition.
Teams per IIT: 2
Duration: 5 mins
Rules: English words prohibited.

Individual Event. Fast-paced speaking.
Teams per IIT: 5
Rules: Queen's English only. No gesticulation. Standard JAM Objection rules apply.

Group Event. 3 speakers + 2 adjudicators.
Duration: 2 days
Structure: 4 prelim rounds, Semis, Finals. Motions with veto. UADC norms followed.

1. Originality: Whether the composition is original or not must be announced before performance. Incorrect claims lead to invalidation. Non-original entries get Zero score points for creativity/originality.
2. Time Penalties: Performances exceeding 5 minutes face penalties (-10 points). Exceeding 6 minutes leads to disqualification (Slam Poetry/Mushaira).
3. Vulgarity/Obscenity: Strictly dealt with; may lead to disqualification at judge's discretion.
4. Reading Aids: Participants may carry paper or phone for reference.
5. Judge's Decision: Final and binding in case of discrepancies.
For any queries related to the Speaking Arts Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
The Comedic Arts Cup features Stand Up Comedy and Improv Battle, testing humor, spontaneity, and audience engagement.

Individual Event. Stand-up set before a live audience.
Teams per IIT: 3
Duration: 8 minutes
Time Penalties apply (>8 min).

Group Event. Spontaneous improvisational comedy.
Teams per IIT: 2
Participants: 3–4
Duration: ~8 minutes (judge decides)

1. Any plagiarism will lead to immediate disqualification on the judge's discretion.
2. Obscenity and vulgarity are left to the judges' discretion.
3. The performance must be delivered in only English or Hindi; vernacular words may be used as a part of a joke.
4. Any form of pre-recorded music is not allowed during performance.
5. Props are allowed but carry no weightage.
6. Visual aids (slides/videos/pictures) are not to be used.
7. Penalties against heckling:
   a. First offence: Warning.
   b. Second offence: 20% Event Points deducted.
   c. Third offence: 50% Event Points deducted.
   d. Fourth offence: Disqualification.
For queries, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
The Dance Arts Cup showcases talent through Group Dance, Just Duet, and Street Battle events.

Group Event. Cohesive unit performance.
Teams per IIT: 1
Size: 5-35 members
Duration: 5-15 mins
Rules: Music 5-13 mins. Props allowed. <15s choreography copy limit.

Group Event (Duet). Two dancers.
Teams per IIT: 2
Duration: 2.5-6 mins
Rules: Props allowed. <15s choreography copy limit.

Group Event. Freestyle/Street styles (Locking, Popping, Breaking, etc.).
Teams per IIT: 1
Participants: 1-10
Format: Eliminative battles (3 rounds of 45s).

1. Stunts that pose any risk to life are not permitted.
2. Spilling of powdery substance, fluids, usage of fire, props or any substance that might damage the stage is strictly not allowed. Penalty: 30 Score Points. Teams must restore stage to original condition.
3. Tracks for Group Dance and Just Duet shall be submitted in MP3 format by the stipulated schedule.
4. Vulgarity and obscenity are strictly not allowed. It will be left to the judges' discretion, and their decision will be final.
5. Clean Stage: If a stage is found not clean, the culprit team will be given a deduction of 30 Score Points. Damaged stage leads to disqualification.
For queries related to the Dance Arts Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
The Theatre Arts Cup includes Street Play, Stage Play, Mono Acting, and Mime.

Group Event. Outdoor performance.
Teams per IIT: 1
Participants: 5-30
Time: 15-30 mins
Rules: English/Hindi. No microphones. 30x30ft area.

Group Event. Live performance with audience.
Teams per IIT: 1
Participants: Max 30
Time: 55-70 mins
Rules: English/Hindi. Flammable substances prohibited.

Group Event. Monologue by single actor.
Teams per IIT: 2
Participants: 1 actor + max 4 background
Time: 5-10 mins

Group Event. Skit in mime form.
Teams per IIT: 1
Participants: 5-12
Time: 5-10 mins
Rules: No dialogue/voiceover. No props/costumes.

1. Content: Harmful content to specific social, economic, religious, gender, or political groups is strictly punishable and can lead to disqualification.
2. Vulgarity and Obscenity are strictly prohibited and can lead to disqualification.
3. Safety: Spilling of powdery substance, fluids, usage of fire, or substances that damage the stage is strictly not allowed (Penalty: 30 Score Points).
4. Stage Cleanliness: Teams must restore the stage to original condition. If stage is not clean: 30 Score Points deduction. If damaged: Disqualification.
5. Empty Stage: 'Empty/clean stage' is stipulated as the requirement for start and end timings.
For queries related to the Theatre Arts Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
The Musical Arts Cup consists of Band Competition, Pair on Stage, Solo Singing, and Classical Vocal Solo.

Group Event. Synchronized performance.
Teams per IIT: 1
Participants: 3-20
Duration: 25 mins (+5 setup)
Rules: Live instruments required (no pre-recorded tracks). Original compositions encouraged.

Group Event. Duet (instrumental/vocal).
Teams per IIT: 1
Participants: 2
Duration: 10 mins
Rules: Live-looping permitted. No pre-recorded tracks.

Individual Event. Light/Western music.
Teams per IIT: 2
Duration: 7 mins
Rules: Max 1 acoustic/percussion accompaniment. No karaoke.

Individual Event. Hindustani and Carnatic.
Teams per IIT: 2
Duration: 7 mins
Rules: Electronic Tanpura/Tabla provided. No other instruments.

1. Equipment: A standard 5-piece drum kit is provided. Teams must bring additional instruments.
2. Stage Setup: Modifications permitted but must be restored. Damage leads to disqualification/penalties.
3. Pre-performance Check: Next performing team verifies setup while previous leaves.
4. Judging Duration: Judges evaluate from 'AMPS ON' to 'AMPS OFF'. Pieces before 'AMPS ON' are not judged.
5. Profanity in lyrics is strictly prohibited. Lyrics must be submitted beforehand.
6. Reporting: Participants must report 15 mins before start.
For queries regarding the Musical Arts Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
The Film Making Cup includes 51 Hour Short Filmmaking and Online Short Filmmaking competitions.

Group Event. Script, shoot, edit in 51 hours.
Teams per IIT: 1
Duration: 3-8 mins
Submission: Offline (Final + Raw shots).
Rules: Shot within Kanpur boundaries. No ID of IIT in film.

Group Event. Theme-based.
Teams per IIT: 1
Duration: 4-15 mins
Submission: Online (Dec 22 deadline).
Rules: Max 20% stock footage. Max 7% screentime for external actors.

1. Content: Must be appropriate for public screening. No vulgarity/obscenity (Penalty: -5 pts for missing disclaimers).
2. Subtitles: English subtitles compulsory for non-English dialogue. Penalty based on duration of missing subtitles.
3. Synopsis: 100-word synopsis mandatory (Penalty: -10 pts for missing).
4. Music: Copied lyrical music prohibited (Penalty: -10 pts). Royalty-free/Original music allowed with credits.
5. Credits: Original compositions must be credited (Penalty: -8 pts). Stock footage must be credited.
6. Anonymity: Movie must not explicitly or implicitly suggest the name of the IIT.
7. Late Submission: Penalties apply for every 15 mins/hour delayed.
For queries regarding the Film Making Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
The Fine Arts Cup features Live Sketching, Canvas Painting, Charcoal Art, and Costume Design.

Individual Event. Pencil sketch of inanimate object.
Teams per IIT: 3
Duration: 4 hours
Materials: Graphite pencils, erasers, blending stumps allowed. No mechanical pencils/charcoal.

Individual Event. Acrylic painting on canvas.
Teams per IIT: 3
Duration: 4 hours
Materials: Acrylic paint only. No scales/stencils.

Group Event. Charcoal medium.
Teams per IIT: 1
Duration: 4 hours
Materials: Charcoal pencils/sticks allowed. No graphite/pre-made powder.

Group Event. Create costume for a member.
Teams per IIT: 1
Duration: 4 hours
Materials: Paper, wire, glue, junk items. No paints/colors.

1. External Help: No use of photos, internet, or references apart from the live model/object is allowed. Penalties imposed for using external sources.
2. Materials: Strict adherence to allowed/restricted materials per event. Generally, scales, rulers, stencils, and mechanical tools are restricted unless specified.
3. Provided Materials: Organising Committee provides sheets/canvas/boards; participants bring specific tools.
4. Write-up: Some events require a write-up (e.g., Canvas Painting) with word limit penalties.
For queries regarding the Fine Arts Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
The Digital Arts Cup covers Photoshop Battle, 3D Sculpting, Graphic Design, 3D Animation, and Design Marathon.

Group Event. Live photo editing.
Duration: 6 hours
Rules: No GenAI. Adobe Photoshop 2022+ allowed. Screenshots required every 30 mins.

Group Event. Sculpt complete 3D model.
Duration: 6 hours
Rules: No texturing. No external assets/GenAI. Screenshots required.

Online Individual Event. Theme-based.
Submission: Final draft + raw files + 3 stages.
Rules: No GenAI. Screenshots required daily.

Online Group Event. Create 10s animation.
Rules: No GenAI. Base animation provided. Screenshots required.

Offline Group Event. 24 hours.
Task: Solve various projects (Poster, UI/UX, Logo, etc.).
Rules: No GenAI. Screenshots required.

1. Artificial Intelligence: Use of Generative fill, or AI of any kind, is strictly prohibited across all events.
2. Proof of Work: Screenshots must be submitted periodically (every 30 mins or daily depending on event) to avoid plagiarism. Penalties apply for missing screenshots.
3. Plagiarism: Any sign of plagiarism leads to disqualification.
4. Late Submission: Penalties are deducted for late submissions (5-15 pts) up to a limit, after which submission is rejected.
For queries regarding the Digital Arts Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
Photography Arts Cup includes Street Photography, Themed Photography, and Photostory Competition.

Offline Group Event. Photos taken on streets.
Teams per IIT: 1
Submission: In person (RAW + JPEG).
Rules: Shot within Kanpur/Lucknow. Captions required.

Online Group Event. Theme-based.
Submission: Via mail (RAW + JPEG).
Rules: Global editing only.

Group Event. Digital narrative (5-15 photos).
Submission: Via mail.
Rules: Max 100 word caption.

1. Camera: Resolution should be at least 3.2 megapixels.
2. Metadata: Photographs must contain EXIF data (date, edit history). Entries without Metadata or with stripped metadata will be disqualified.
3. Format: Participants must submit both RAW (CR2, NEF, etc.) and edited (JPEG) images.
4. Anonymity: No identifying credentials (watermarks, names, club names) allowed in the frame or EXIF data.
5. Editing: Only global editing is allowed. Local editing leads to disqualification.
6. Captions: Mandatory PDF with captions (word limit penalties apply).
7. Late Submission: Points deducted for delay (5-15 pts).
For queries regarding the Photography Arts Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
The Fashion Cup includes the Fashion Show and Online Modelling Competition.

Group Event. Runway display.
Teams per IIT: 1
Participants: 8-18
Duration: 15 mins
Rules: Live narration allowed. Tracks submitted in MP3.

Individual Event. 5 editorial shots.
Entries per IIT: Max 3
Rules: Full-body, head shot, candid, lifestyle, environmental. RAW+JPEG required.

1. Safety: Stunts posing risk to life are not permitted. No dangerous substances (fire, liquids) allowed.
2. Stage Condition: Teams must restore stage to original condition. Penalties/Disqualification for dirty or damaged stage.
3. Vulgarity: Not allowed. Obscenity is at judge's discretion.
4. Anonymity (Modelling): No credentials in frame/metadata.
5. Time Penalties: Deductions for exceeding time limits.
For queries regarding the Fashion Arts Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
The Culinary Arts Cup features Cook Off, Tag Team, and Mixology competitions.

Group Event. Timed cooking (2 dishes).
Teams per IIT: 1
Duration: 2 hours
Rules: Common ingredient list. Induction based.

Group Event. Relay cooking (switch every 15 mins).
Teams per IIT: 1
Duration: 1 hour
Rules: 1 cook at a time. Surprise ingredient.

Group Event. Mocktail making (3 drinks).
Teams per IIT: 1
Duration: 1 hour
Rules: 3 color palette + theme.

General Rules:
1. Equipment Provided: Basic cooking equipment (cutlery, utensils, cookware, mixer grinder, induction) and presentation equipment (plates, bowls) provided by OC.
2. Participant Equipment: Permitted to bring non-electric equipment (manual tools). No open flames or fire allowed.
3. Restricted: Personal presentation items (unique plates/bowls) are strictly prohibited.
4. Inspection: All equipment inspected before event. Non-compliance leads to disqualification.
For any queries regarding the Culinary Arts Cup, contact the Inter IIT Cultural Meet Organising Committee.
